TopicTitle: How do I get into my ksp folder if my game is on Steam?

Articles.Content:
So I recently transferred (Spell check told me that there are two 'r's in Transferred but I swear it doesn't look right?) my ksp game to the steam version at this update, and I want to make a custom flag, So i was going to go mess around with the stock flags in GIMP, but I can't find the ksp folder, Which isn't good because i am switching hard drives soon and need to get some planes off. Thanks for the Help.

P.S. I can't tell if that is an extremely long run on sentence or just a very complex compound one. >.<

Edited May 27, 2013 by iRaven

From my experience all Steam games end up in the Steam folder:

Steam/Steamapps/Common

So that's probably a good place to start looking.
I confirm, KSP should be there Steam/Steamapps/Common

Just keep in mind, that the Steam folder on 64 bit systems is usually in \Program Files (x86)\Steam..

And yep: KSP is in ..\Steam\SteamApps\Common\Kerbal Space Program.
And the stock flags are in ...\Steam\SteamApps\Common\Kerbal Space Program\Gamedata\Squad\Flags.
You can also right click kerbals space program in the game library and go to properties, then select browse local files.
Thanks Guys! Got it all open right here.
I need some help, i'm installing KW rocketry v 2.7 but there's no mechjeb2 file and it says don't extract the file please help!
